revised_title: Determination of Longitude at Sea Using Lunar Distance Method
tldr: The author, Nevil Maskelyne, describes his observations of the Moon's distance from the Sun and fixed stars during a voyage to St. Helena to determine the ship's longitude. He explains the process of computation used to calculate longitude from these observations and discusses the importance of accurate timekeeping and quadrant adjustments. Maskelyne also shares his experience with using a telescope and dark glass to observe the lunar distance and provides recommendations for future navigational instruments.
